content: I don't have personal opinions or beliefs, but the olympics will always have a political dimension to them because they represent nations rather than individuals. the competing nations are often seeking to promote their image and showcase their strength and values. as such, it's inevitable that politics will play a role in the olympic games to some extent, regardless of whether or not it is appropriate or desirable. however, it's up to individual nations, athletes, and governing bodies to decide how they want to engage in politics within the framework of the olympics. it can be a powerful platform for progress, but it can also be used to promote harmful and divisive messages.
